channel.title: Comments on: The early evolution of dinosaurs

item.title: By: The early evolution of dinosaurs | Science Communication Blog Network
item.dc:creator: The early evolution of dinosaurs | Science Communication Blog Network

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/the-early-evolution-of-dinosaurs/#comment-420">Herman Diaz</a>.
Hi Herman,
The fossil depictions seem accurate to me. The total environmental restoration will always be a little leap of faith, as the fossil record only preserves scraps that hint at the bigger picture. I don't know about Steve Kirk's work, but I'd imagine that anything from 1996 would be considered a bit out of date by palaeo-standards, given the number of findings from the Triassic in recent years!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Herman Diaz.

Hi Herman,

The fossil depictions seem accurate to me. The total environmental restoration will always be a little leap of faith, as the fossil record only preserves scraps that hint at the bigger picture. I don’t know about Steve Kirk’s work, but I’d imagine that anything from 1996 would be considered a bit out of date by palaeo-standards, given the number of findings from the Triassic in recent years!

item.title: By: Herman Diaz
item.dc:creator: Herman Diaz
item.description:
"Cool restoration of a Triassic ecosystem, where dinosaurs were only just starting out"
I have a question about that: Would you consider that & Steve Kirk's other restorations as accurate for the time (1996)? I ask b/c I'm reading a book w/several of them, but wasn't sure. Many thanks in advance.
item.content:encoded:
“Cool restoration of a Triassic ecosystem, where dinosaurs were only just starting out”

I have a question about that: Would you consider that & Steve Kirk’s other restorations as accurate for the time (1996)? I ask b/c I’m reading a book w/several of them, but wasn’t sure. Many thanks in advance.
